business.headline: Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

Budget 2026: From mental health to medtech, healthcare seeks policy pushAhead of Union Budget 2026, voices from across the healthcare ecosystem are drawing attention to long-standing gaps. While funding has improved in recent years, experts say sharper policy focus is needed on mental health, medtech and early diagnosis.

Supreme Court rules Tiger Global must pay tax on $1.6 billion Flipkart-Walmart dealThe top court ruled that Tiger Global is not entitled to claim tax exemption under the India–Mauritius treaty. It agreed with the Income Tax Department's view that the structure used for the transaction was aimed at avoiding tax liability in India.

Budget 2026: Edtech and adtech seek policy support for AI-led growthWith artificial intelligence playing a growing role in education and digital advertising, industry leaders are looking to Budget 2026 for policy measures that support innovation, skills development and sustainable growth.

India and EU inch closer to finalising trade deal: ReportSenior European Union leaders are set to attend India's Republic Day celebrations on January 26, followed by the India–EU Summit on January 27, where the trade deal is expected to be a key topic.

Budget 2026: Is the old income tax regime slowly on its way out?As Union Budget 2026 draws closer, taxpayers are wondering whether the old income tax regime is nearing a phase-out. While it still exists today, many are questioning whether continued policy support for the new regime signals a gradual discontinuation of the old one.

Can Budget 2026 turn household gold into economic growth?India holds a vast amount of gold in households, much of which remains unused for economic activity. As Budget 2026 approaches, experts believe the government has an opportunity to turn this idle wealth into a driver of growth.

Can Budget 2026 unlock the next phase of India's clean energy transition?With targeted actions from the upcoming Union Budget, India's energy sector could move beyond capacity building and towards more reliable, flexible, and competitive clean power for industrial and commercial consumers nationwide.

For a local poll? Zerodha CEO slams poor planning as markets shut for BMC electionNithin Kamath's comments come on a day when Dalal Street is closed after the Maharashtra government declared January 15 a public holiday to ensure smooth polling for local body elections.

Waiting for BCCL shares? Check your allotment status, expected profit hereBCCL shares: The allotment status is now available, and investors can check whether they have received shares in the first mainboard IPO of 2026, which saw massive demand during the subscription period.
BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Indian stock markets will remain closed for a total of 16 days in 2026. January 26 will be the next market holiday this month.

Budget 2026: Will tax reforms and clearer rules revive India's crypto market?With the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, the virtual digital asset sector is hoping for changes that can ease taxation and provide regulatory certainty. Experts believe this could reignite growth in India's crypto ecosystem.

Wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December as prices firm upFood prices showed mixed trends during the month. Wholesale food inflation remained flat in December, compared with a sharp 2.6% decline recorded in November.

entertainment.headline: Stebin Ben thanks Salman Khan for attending his wedding reception: Man of his word Salman Khan stole the spotlight at Stebin Ben and Nupur Sanon's wedding reception, leaving the newly-weds visibly starstruck as videos and pictures from the night went viral. Stebin later thanked the superstar on social media, calling his presence and blessings unforgettable.

The RajaSaab box office Day 7: Prabhas' film sees no boost despite Sankranti holiday The box office collection of 'The RajaSaab', featuring Prabhas, did not see a boost despite Sankrant holiday. The film earned Rs 130 crore on its seventh day.

Pamela Anderson says sitting near Seth Rogen at Golden Globes felt weird and yucky Pamela Anderson shared in a recent interview that she felt uneasy being near Seth Rogen at the Golden Globes, citing unresolved issues stemming from the making of Hulu's 'Pam & Tommy' series, which depicted personal aspects of her life without her involvement.

Emraan Hashmi on breaking the serial kisser image: It's always a journey Emraan Hashmi reflected on breaking out of his 'serial kisser' image, saying it took a journey of diverse roles rather than one defining performance to overcome being typecast.

Samantha celebrates first Sankranti with husband Raj Nidimoru, shares a goofy pic Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu celebrated Makar Sankranti with her husband Raj Nidimoru for the first time. She shared a goofy picture on the occasion.

120 Bahadur OTT release: When and where to watch Farhan Akhtar's war drama Prime Video has launched the global streaming of 120 Bahadur, a war drama based on the Battle of Rezang La. The film honours the bravery of Indian soldiers, bringing their story to a worldwide audience.

She's 4: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas celebrate daughter Malti's birthday Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Nick Jonas celebrated daughter Malti Marie's fourth birthday with a Little Mermaid–themed party, sharing glimpses of the undersea-inspired celebration on social media.

Javed Akhtar recalls a time when assistant directors were disrespected on film sets Javed Akhtar spoke at the Jaipur Literature Festival about secularism and changing work cultures. He highlighted the importance of lived experience and reflected on shifts in the film industry and generational attitudes.

Exclusive: Kim Seon-ho, Go Youn-jung on Love Beyond Words, connection with fans Netflix's Can This Love Be Translated explores a tender romance with Kim Seon-ho and Go Youn-jung. The series highlights love's complexity and emotional language across three countries.

Dhurandhar actor Saumya Tandon says her name was missing from BMC poll list Saumya Tandon faced confusion while attempting to vote in the Mumbai BMC elections after discovering her name was missing from the voter list despite prior online verification.

AR Rahman explains how he added Sanskrit words to Ramayana track with Hans Zimmer Composer AR Rahman shared insights into the process of working with Hans Zimmer on the music for Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana, highlighting the challenges and creative efforts involved in blending iconic sounds with Sanskrit words to offer a fresh interpretation of the epic.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Emotions run high in first finalists-only episode The final leg of the show begins on an emotional note as the house celebrates Sankranthi, reflects on past conflicts, and gears up for the Bigg Boss Kannada 12 finale.

Sophie Turner steps into Lara Croft role in Tomb Raider series. First look Prime Video unveiled the first look of Sophie Turner as Lara Croft from a wardrobe test for its upcoming Tomb Raider series, confirming her transformation into the iconic video game hero.

Kara teaser: Wounded Dhanush vows to wipe stain upon his name in gritty actioner The first teaser for Kara, Dhanush's newly titled film, introduced viewers to a mysterious, action-driven narrative, highlighting his portrayal as Karasaami. The film is directed by Vignesh Raja and is scheduled for a summer 2026 release.

Riya Shibu: My role as Gen-Z ghost in Sarvam Maya has redefined screen horror In an exclusive interaction with India Today, Malayalam actor Riya Shibu reflected on her character as the Delulu ghost in the latest release 'Sarvam Maya'. The film, also starring Nivin Pauly, is currently running in theatres and has surpassed the Rs-100 crore milestone.

Jodie Foster says Taxi Driver fame shielded her from sexual abuse in Hollywood Jodie Foster reflected on her early years as a child actor and said her Oscar-nominated role in Taxi Driver gave her a level of power that helped protect her from sexual predators in Hollywood.

Paul McCartney opens up on life after The Beatles in Man on the Run Man on the Run sees Paul McCartney reflect on the emotional fallout of The Beatles' breakup, including depression, the "Paul is dead" rumour and his fear of never making music again. The documentary traces his creative rebirth through Wings and his enduring partnership with wife Linda McCartney.

Hans Zimmer on board as composer for HBO's Harry Potter series HBO's upcoming adaptation of the Harry Potter books will feature an original score by Hans Zimmer and Bleeding Fingers Music, aiming to honour and reimagine the saga's musical legacy for television.

Harry Styles announces new album 'Kiss All The Time. Disco, Occasionally'. Details Singer Harry Styles has confirmed a new album, titled 'Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally'. in an announcement that sets his musical direction for 2026.

general news.headline: BMC Live Results: BJP-Sena dominates with 100+ in leads, Thackerays falterMumbai BMC Election Results Live Updates: Counting of votes for the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) election began at 10 am on Friday, following polling held on January 15 alongside elections to 28 other local bodies across Maharashtra. Authorities have set up 23 counting centres across Mumbai, with tight security in place. Exit polls have projected a decisive victory for the BJP–Shiv Sena alliance in the BMC, while forecasting a setback for the Shiv Sena (UBT)–Maharashtra Navnirman Sena combine. The contest carries high political stakes, with the BJP-led Mahayuti taking on the reunited Thackeray cousins -- Raj Thackeray of the MNS and Uddhav Thackeray of the Shiv Sena (UBT) -- for control of India's richest civic body. Follow indiatoday.in for all Live Updates.

Trump took Machado's medal, but can Nobel Peace Prize be transferred?Venezuela's Machado gave her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump. This marked the first time in history that a Nobel Prize laureate voluntarily handed over the medal. But can such an award actually be transferred?

Live: Saffron sweep loading across Maharashtra, Latur consolation for CongressMaharashtra Civic Body Election Result Live Updates: After nearly nine years, Maharashtra held civic body elections across 29 municipal corporations, including key urban centres such as Mumbai, Pune, Thane, Nagpur, Pimpri-Chinchwad and Nashik. With polling completed on Thursday and an overall turnout of 46–50 per cent, attention has now shifted to counting, that began today. The elections featured several high-profile political contests. The coming together of the Thackeray brothers to take on the BJP-led alliance, including Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena, emerged as a major talking point. In Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad, members of the Pawar family joined forces to defend their traditional strongholds. Notably, despite being on opposite sides at the state level, the NCP and NCP (SP) put aside differences for the municipal polls and jointly fielded candidates, adding another layer of intrigue to the results. Stay with IndiaToday.in for the latest and live updates-

First BMC winner: Congress triumphs in Dharavi challenge against Shiv SenaThe win marks Congress's first confirmed success in this fiercely contested civic poll, signalling a potential challenge to established political strongholds in central Mumbai.

Mid-sea chase, gunfire: How 16 Indian sailors were taken hostage by Iran16 Indian sailors aboard a merchant vessel have been in the custody of Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) for over one month. The vessel was chased by the IRGC in international waters and even fired at, leading to damage and injuries to some crew members. Now, amid the bloody unrest in Iran, the families of the crew members have sought urgent intervention by PM Modi.

Surveillance or to push arms? Why Pakistan is sending drones into IndiaThe UAVs being sent by Pakistan are not the suicide drones that were deployed during the hostilities in May last year. These are mostly small, reconnaissance-oriented drones flying at very low altitudes.

Replacing medicines, India giving Pak a bitter pill to swallow in AfghanistanAn Afghan vlogger has claimed that Indian medicines that are cheaper and work better are fast-replacing Pakistani drugs. India has sent tonnes of medical assistance to Afghanistan even as the Taliban-led regime's ties with Pakistan hit rock bottom. Earlier, Pakistan-made drugs accounted for 70% of all medicines in the Afghan market.

Who is deciding India's foreign policy?External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar often makes headlines for his sharp and pointed soundbites. And yet, there have been enough moments when the minister must wonder who is calling the shots in South Block. The handling of relations with Bangladesh exemplifies the latest instance of diplomatic confusion.

The price of a kingdom: How Kashmir became inseparable from JammuIn the high-stakes theatre of modern Himalayan politics, a long-dormant question has resurfaced. Sajad Lone, President of the Jammu & Kashmir Peoples Conference, recently signalled a potential turning point in the region's history, suggesting it is time to "reconsider the administrative arrangement" between the Kashmir and Jammu divisions.

Shinde Sena leads in stronghold Thane, Thackerays yet to open accountBesides the Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) of Thane, the counting of votes is also underway for 28 other urban civic bodies across Maharashtra, including the high-stakes Brihanmumbai Municipa Corporation (BMC) of Mumbai.

Elon Musk might have found the secret to immortality, says you can soon have itElon Musk is giving you a chance to become immortal. On X, the tech billionaire revealed a way you can reach immortality soon, and perhaps have your stories be read by aliens in the distant future.

BJP takes massive lead in Pune civic poll results, Opposition in single digitsThe BJP surged ahead in the Pune civic elections as early trends showed a wide gap over rivals. The Pawar-led NCP alliance remained in single digits while Shiv Sena UBT has failed to open accounts.

UP CM Yogi Adityanath asks toddler what he wants, gets the cutest reply everUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath shared an adorable moment with a toddler at Gorakhpur's Khichdi festival, where the child's unexpected request charmed the internet.

After 15,000 layoffs, Microsoft cuts staff library and newspaper accessMicrosoft laid off 15,000 employees in 2025. With rumours indicating more layoffs around the corner, the Redmond-based giant has now cut back on newspapers and library subscriptions for its staff, while focusing more on AI-based learning.

Priya Kapur approaches Supreme Court for Sunjay Kapur-Karisma Kapoor divorce recordsPriya Kapur has sought access to the said divorce records to ascertain the financial and child custody arrangements made by her late former husband.
Ex-South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol gets 5 years in jail over martial law bidSouth Korean court sentences ex-President Yoon Suk Yeol to 5 years in jail over martial law bid
Can't stop scrolling at night? How a 'Digital Sunset' can fix your sleepA digital sunset is the kind of "view" your nervous system prefers - one that supports both your mind and body.

India wants the Olympics, but is it truly ready to host the world?The India Open exposed more than polluted air. It revealed recurring failures in how India plans, manages and acknowledges hosting shortcomings, failures the country must confront before its Olympic ambitions can be taken seriously.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Justice Yashwant Varma's plea against parliamentary probe into cash row dismissedThe Supreme Court dismissed Justice Yashwant Varma's plea challenging the parliamentary committee probing corruption charges against him, allowing the inquiry to proceed.
Why Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve is burning in wintersWhile fires are a recurring problem in the Himalayan state, what stands out this year is how early and widespread they have been.

Why do humans eat more when food is freeUnlimited breakfast buffets trigger a unique psychological response causing overeating. This behaviour stems from fear of missing out rather than true hunger, highlighting how environment shapes eating habits.

Woman alleges child walked into their Hyatt room, found staff inside; hotel respondsA woman claimed that two hotel staff members entered their room using a master key, despite the room having already been cleaned earlier in the day and no housekeeping or service request having been made. She said her six-year-old niece walked into the room moments later and found two unknown adults inside.

Iran backs down on 800 executions after Trump's warning, White House confirms Live UpdatesWhite House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said Trump and his team had delivered a direct warning to Iranian officials, linking the planned executions to what Washington described as violent repression of demonstrators.

sports.headline: Does Kohli play ODIs because it's easy? Harbhajan responds to Manjrekar's wild claim Harbhajan Singh defended Virat Kohli after Sanjay Manjrekar called ODIs the "easiest" format, saying greatness isn't about formats and that Kohli remains a match-winner for India.

ICC delegation likely to visit Bangladesh for T20 World Cup talks A delegation from the International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to visit Bangladesh soon for in-person discussions regarding the country's participation in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, scheduled to be hosted by India and Sri Lanka from February 7.

Who is Henil Patel? Dale Steyn fan is India's 5-star hero in World Cup opener U19 World Cup 2026: 18-year-old Henil Patel made a mark on the opening day of the tournament, picking up a five-wicket haul. The fast bowler from Gujarat idolises Dale Steyn.

Harleen Deol retired-out saga revealed communication gap in coaching: Abhishek Nayar UP Warriorz coach Abhishek Nayar said the Harleen Deol retired-out episode exposed a communication gap, admitting that coaching in the WPL has been more hands-on and challenging than expected.

Roger Federer returns to Australian Open, beats World No. 12 in tie-breaker: Watch Roger Federer made a highly anticipated return to Melbourne Park with a spirited practice session against Casper Ruud. The 20-time Grand Slam champion will compete in an exhibition match on Saturday, a day before the main draw of the Australian Open gets underway.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru look to stay perfect against in-form Gujarat Giants WPL 2026: Royal Challengers Bengaluru face Gujarat Giants in a key WPL 2026 clash, with RCB eyeing a third straight win as Gujarat look to fix bowling issues at DY Patil Stadium.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi's U19 run could hurt him: Ex-India cricketer makes bold statement Former India cricketer WV Raman has sparked debate by questioning whether Under-19 cricket is the right pathway for teenage prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi despite his rapid rise.

India wants the Olympics, but is it truly ready to host the world? The India Open exposed more than polluted air. It revealed recurring failures in how India plans, manages and acknowledges hosting shortcomings, failures the country must confront before its Olympic ambitions can be taken seriously.

One year on, Aryna Sabalenka seeks to heal old wounds at the Australian Open Australian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka suffered a shock defeat to Madison Keys in last year's Australian Open final, and the world No. 1 will be eager to reassert her dominance when this year's hard-court showpiece unfolds in Melbourne.

Harleen Deol makes her bat do the talking, bounces back from batter's worst nightmare Harleen Deol bounced back from the setback of being retired out by producing a commanding 64 against Mumbai Indians, letting her bat do the talking and reaffirming her value to UP Warriorz.

Bangladesh cricketers to end boycott if ex-director issues public apology: Report Bangladesh's cricketers have made a public apology from former BCB chairman Nazmul Islam a key condition for ending their boycott, with domestic competitions remaining affected as talks with the board continue.

Clock's ticking on Ravindra Jadeja's ODI career as Axar Patel waits on the sidelinesIND vs NZ: India's loss in the 2nd ODI has intensified scrutiny on Ravindra Jadeja, whose recent struggles with both bat and ball have raised concerns about his place in the side. With Axar Patel's rapid rise, Jadeja's days in the ODI setup look numbered as the all-rounder is in a race against time to prove his worth.

Harleen Deol reacts to retire out saga after heroics vs Mumbai IndiansWPL 2026: 24 hours after being retired out against Delhi Capitals, Harleen Deol starred with an unbeaten 64 as UP Warriorz secured their first win, defeating Mumbai Indians by seven wickets.

Vidharbha storm in Vijay Hazare Trophy final, knock defending champion Karnataka outVidarbha outplayed defending champions Karnataka with a dominant all-round display, clinching a six-wicket win to book their place in the Vijay Hazare Trophy final.

Retire out to heroics: Harleen Deol seals UP Warriorz maiden win of WPL 2026WPL 2026, MI vs UPW: Harleen Deol scored an unbeaten 64 as the UP Warriorz opened their account with a seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Thursday in Navi Mumbai.

Rejuvenated Lakshya keeps India's hopes alive after rusty Sat-Chi crash outIndia Open 2026: Former champion Lakshya Sen stormed into the quarters, keeping India's hopes alive on a day when big guns, including Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty, KidambI Srikanth and HS Prannoy crashed out in New Delhi.

Smriti Mandhana returns to The Hundred Women, joins Manchester Super GiantsSmriti Mandhana returns to The Hundred with Manchester Super Giants for 2026 after standout WPL form, bringing proven experience, big-match pedigree and elite top-order firepower to a star-studded squad.

Manoj Tiwary slams boxer Mary Kom over allegations on ex-husband, deletes videoFormer cricketer Manoj Tiwary criticised Mary Kom for publicly disrespecting her ex-husband, saying her comments caused him pain and highlighted the importance of mutual support in relationships.

BWF backs Delhi for Badminton World C'ships, vows to address hygiene concernsThe Badminton World Federation has backed Delhi to remain as the venue for the World Championships later in the year amid hygiene concerns during the India Open.

U19 World Cup: Henil, Kundu star but India off to shaky start with win over USAU19 World Cup 2026: India overcame a tricky chase against USA in the U19 World Cup as Abhigyan Kundu held firm and Henil Patel starred with a five-wicket haul. India won the rain-marred match by six wickets in the end via DLS method.

I breathe less: Ex-world champ Loh says Delhi air hurting players at India OpenFormer world champion Loh Kean Yew said Delhi's air pollution has impacted players' energy levels at the India Open. The tournament faces mounting criticism over conditions and hygiene from several top shuttlers.

Ashes hero Starc bags ICC award for his sensational performance vs EnglandMitchell Starc ended Australia's wait for an ICC Player Of The Month award as he was rewarded for his performance against England in the Ashes on Thursday, January 15. Starc was the Player Of The Series during the matches against England.

Neeraj Chopra begins pre-season training in South Africa after MOC approvalNeeraj Chopra, India's two-time Olympic medallist in javelin throw, has begun his 32-day pre-season training camp in Potchefstroom, South Africa, after receiving approval from the Sports Ministry's Mission Olympic Cell.

Kuldeep is No.1 spinner in the world: Chahal backs India star after Rajkot ODIYuzvendra Chahal has jumped to the defence of Kuldeep Yadav after his horror show during the Rajkot ODI against New Zealand on January 14. Kuldeep leaked runs and was the most expensive bowler in the game.

AIFF says ISL gets AFC recognition; ISL, Super Cup champions to get indirect slotsThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Thursday confirmed that the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has recognised the truncated 2025-26 Indian Super League, with winners of the ISL and Super Cup earning indirect entry into the AFC Champions League 2 via zonal qualifiers.

Dirty drop: Bird poop halts India Open match, day after monkey spotted in standsIndia Open 2026: The men's singles pre-quarters match between HS Prannoy and Loh Kean Yew was halted twice after bird droppings fell on the main court. The halts came days after the BAI assured the venue was pigeon-free, while responding to Denmark shuttler Mia Blichfeldt's allegations of unhygienic playing conditions in New Delhi.

Bangladesh Cricket Board sack director M Najmul Islam after players boycott BPLThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) on Thursday sacked director M Nazmul Islam, relieving him of all responsibilities, including his position as head of the finance committee, following demands from cricketers.

Mehidy Hasan slams BCB director over bizarre remarks: Shameful, inappropriateMehidy Hasan Miraz slammed BCB director M. Najmul Islam's "shameful" remarks on player compensation, triggering backlash from cricketers and boycott threats amid Bangladesh's T20 World Cup uncertainty.

India's Henil Patel wreaks havoc with sensational five-wicket haul vs USAIndia made a thunderous start to their ICC Under-19 World Cup campaign as Henil Patel spearheaded a ruthless bowling performance with a five-wicket haul to dismantle the USA for a paltry 107 in 35.2 overs on Thursday.

Nitish faces trolls, but finds backing from former India batter after Rajkot ODIFormer India batter Hanuma Vihari has jumped to the defence of Nitish Kumar Reddy after the all-rounder was trolled on social media, following his performance in the Rajkot ODI. Nitish didn't have a big role to play in the second match as New Zealand levelled the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
